definition: to phone sb up
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]

sentences.chinese: 我要打一通電話到紐約。

sentences.english: Suddenly the phone rang, the gamble was forced to terminate. < /p> < p> Tianlong.
sentences.chinese: 突然一通電話響起，令賭局被迫終止。

sentences.english: Three calls to Marino were unreturned.
sentences.chinese: 三次嘗試與馬裏諾通電話沒有得到回覆。

sentences.english: We talked on the phone quite often after that.
sentences.chinese: 在那之後我們常常通電話。

sentences.english: After that phone call, I celebrated by having a margarita or two with my wife.
sentences.chinese: 在那通電話之後，我喝了一兩杯瑪格麗塔以示慶祝。

sentences.english: I will speak to Little Four over the telephone.
sentences.chinese: 我一會就和小泗通電話。

sentences.english: Concise and kam fortis phones, jin fu guarantee will persuade grams frequently do not tell son.
sentences.chinese: 簡潔與錦富通電話，錦富保證會勸服克勤不告允兒。

sentences.english: Explore that way of connecting before you talk on the telephone or meet face to face .
sentences.chinese: 在你們通電話或見面之前，要充分運用通信聯繫。

sentences.english: Though we spoke on the phone regularly, I longed for her presence.
sentences.chinese: 雖然我們定期會通通電話，但我還是很想見到她本人。

sentences.english: She starts a fight every time she phones me.
sentences.chinese: 她每次跟我通電話都要跟我爭論。

sentences.english: Now I speak to him every day.
sentences.chinese: 如今我每天都跟他通電話。

sentences.english: The conversation between Bush and Deng, which made Li get the freedom.
sentences.chinese: 正是老布什與鄧的這通電話，讓李存信獲得自由。

sentences.english: Grandad said it as we were hanging up after a call on Christmas day.
sentences.chinese: 外公在聖誕節那天我們通電話掛斷之前說了那句話。

sentences.english: Inquiry service room, the girls receive 1500 calls a month.
sentences.chinese: 諮詢服務室，女孩們一個月要接1500通電話。

sentences.english: If you could at least reply a SMS, or leave message n the MSN, and give me a phone call sometimes.
sentences.chinese: 如果你肯至少回一封簡訊，給我一個留言，一通電話。

sentences.english: Letters and calls from loved ones, you might say, right?
sentences.chinese: 也許你會說，愛人的一份家書或者一通電話。

definition: to sb's face/in sb's presence
to meet/meeting/conference
to meet/to see each other/CL:次[ci4]
(of a sports competition or match) to commence/(of a war or battle) to break out/to perform acrobatic or choreographed fighting (in Chinese opera)/to brawl/to come to blows
to arrange an interview/an appointment (with the foreign ambassador)
newsletter/the news in brief/(Tw) SMS message
SMS/text message
to text/to send SMS messages
face to face
neighbor/next door/CL:個|个[ge4]
to spar/to fight/to duke it out
to hold a conversation/to talk over the telephone/phone call
variant of 關係|关系[guan1 xi5]
slip of paper
to answer the phone

incoming telegram or telephone call/your telegram, telephone call, or message/to send a telegram or make a telephone call here (i.e. to the speaker)/to have instant attraction to sb/to have chemistry with sb/to come back (of electricity, after an outage)
